title: Bureaucrats for Homeless Have the Wrong Incentives
text: Regarding the letters of Oct. 10 responding to Heather Mac Donald’s “The Streets of San Francisco” (op-ed, Oct. 4): If you want to make a problem permanent, put a bureaucracy in charge of solving it. The primary beneficiaries of the money spent on San Francisco’s homelessness problem are the people handing out the needles and the jerky. They have no incentive to eliminate the problem—they have every incentive to make the problem larger. The more homelessness, the bigger the budget, the larger the bureaucracy, the more levels of management and the greater the opportunity for bumped pension benefits and seniority-based advancement....
